sect1.title: About DDCcontrol
sect1.para: DDCcontrol is a tool used to control monitor parameters, like brightness and contrast, without using the OSD (On Screen Display) and the buttons in front of the monitor.
There is two version of this tool, a command line version, and a user-friendly Gnome GUI.

sect1.title: DDC/CI
sect1.para: DDC/CI is a protocol designed by VESA to configure monitor by software, using two wires on the VGA or DVI cables, which forms an I2C bus.

sect1.title: Software Requirement
sect1.para: To compile and run DDCcontrol, you usually need to install these packages:

listitem.para:
pci-utils, available at (***LINK***).
You don't need this package if you don't need to use direct PCI memory access.

gtk+>=2.0, available at (***LINK***).
You don't need this package if you don't plan to use the Gnome GUI (this is usually not the case).

sect1.title: Download the sources
sect1.para: Go to the download section of sourceforge project's page and download the latest ddccontrol and ddccontrol-db source tarballs. (****LINK****)
Then unpack these two archives, you should have two directories, ddccontrol and ddccontrol-db.
